get.summary: Get account information for the user in the Marketing Automation system.

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

post.summary: Create a new campaign in the Marketing Automation service. Campaign creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your Marketing Automation service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Campaign' model are those required to create a new campaign.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
The campaign object to be created.
With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Campaign' model are those required to create a new campaign.

get.summary:
Find campaigns in the Marketing Automation system, using the provided CEQL search expression. The search expression in CEQL is the WHERE clause in a typical SQL query, but without the WHERE keyword. For example, to search for all campaigns whose name contains the word 'data', the search expression parameter will be where=name like '%data%'. If a search expression is not provided, then the first 200 records will be returned.

If a value of true is specified for the includeDeleted flag, then any soft-deleted records will also be considered in the searched records.

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: The CEQL search expression.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type can be: draft, template, sent, triggered, failed, or scheduled. The type defaults to draft

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size for pagination, which defaults to 200 if not supplied
The next page cursor, taken from the response header: `elements-next-page-token`
parameters.name: nextPage

parameters.description: The fields to return on the response. Can be a single field or a comma-separated list of fields
parameters.name: fields

parameters.name: objectName

parameters.description: The {objectName} ID
parameters.name: objectId

400.description: Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter

401.description: Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided

403.description: Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden

404.description: Not found - The requested resource is not found

405.description: Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected

406.description: Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

409.description: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists

415.description: Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type

500.description: Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server

502.description: Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

description.x-samplevalue: The authorization tokens. The format for the header value is 'Element <token>, User <user secret>'
Bad Request - Often due to a missing request parameter
Unauthorized - An invalid element token, user secret and/or org secret provided
Forbidden - Access to the resource by the provider is forbidden
Not found - The requested resource is not found
Method not allowed - Incorrect HTTP verb used, e.g., GET used when POST expected
Not acceptable - The response content type does not match the 'Accept' header value

Object.description: Fields for the object. There will be fields associated with an Object, which are not all described here.

description.x-samplevalue: Conflict - If a resource being created already exists
Unsupported media type - The server cannot handle the requested Content-Type
Server error - Something went wrong on the Cloud Elements server
Provider server error - Something went wrong on the Provider or Endpoint's server

summary.x-samplevalue: Create a new contact in the CRM service. Contact creation will flow through Cloud Elements to your CRM service. With the exception of the 'id' field, the required fields indicated in the 'Contact' model are those required to create a new contact.
